body: Yes, this looks like a bug.

I _suspect_ it might have something to do with this: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/panache/panache-common/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/panache/common/deployment/visitors/KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.java#L573
I can confirm that the Java version of Panache does indeed work, while the Kotlin version of Panache breaks, so what @FWest98 says sounds logical.
I'm not sure, this points to code looking at method parameters being of a type parameter named `Id`.
Well either way, on the Java version I am not having the same issue.
I am blocked on some code with my project because of this bug, is there any plan perhaps to look into it? :)

Trying your test, I get this error:

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Should not run in to duplicate mappings: 
	boolean deleteById(IdT id)
	(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z
	boolean deleteById(java.lang.Object id)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.visitors.KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.lambda$collectMethods$3(KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.java:230)
	at java.base/java.lang.Iterable.forEach(Iterable.java:75)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.visitors.KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.collectMethods(KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.java:223)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.visitors.KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.collectMethods(KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.java:236)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.visitors.KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.<init>(KotlinPanacheClassOperationGenerationVisitor.java:105)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.KotlinPanacheRepositoryEnhancer.apply(KotlinPanacheRepositoryEnhancer.java:25)
	at io.quarkus.panache.common.deployment.KotlinPanacheRepositoryEnhancer.apply(KotlinPanacheRepositoryEnhancer.java:11)
	at io.quarkus.deployment.steps.ClassTransformingBuildStep.transformClass(ClassTransformingBuildStep.java:365)
	at io.quarkus.deployment.steps.ClassTransformingBuildStep$2.call(ClassTransformingBuildStep.java:241)
	at io.quarkus.deployment.steps.ClassTransformingBuildStep$2.call(ClassTransformingBuildStep.java:215)
```

It seems related. I'm looking into it.
I don't know if it's progress, but fixing _this_ bug now makes both "working" and "broken" repos fail ðŸ˜…
That seems concerning, given that this does work for the java version ðŸ˜…

issue.title: KotlinPanache: properly pass type arguments up the chain, ignore bridge methods

body: Yeah, well, it was one bug hiding a few others. Now the tests both pass. Can you try https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/50328 and let us know if this is all there was?
@FroMage tested it against our production issue and this indeed fixes it!
